<< I'm picturing you flipping 35 pancakes, while
balancing on one leg...
>>

Holly helped.

And I can stand on two, or as Holly says, use the broken one as a kick-stand.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] about writing, industry, my leg
messages.msgSnippet: ... A victory!   That was a long time coming.  It must feel really good - well, I expect your leg still hurts like the devil, but it must feel good to be able
messages.messageBody:
> I CAN GO UPSTAIRS!!

A victory! That was a long time coming. It must feel really good -
well, I expect your leg still hurts like the devil, but it must feel good
to be able to get where you want to go, finally.

>Yesterday I made pancakes for the six or seven teenaged boys who were
here,
>and today I have two loaves of bread rising on the stove. Woohoo!!

I could actually smell the bread when I read this. It sounds like a
happy house. I can't think how many pancakes that would be, my ten year
old can eat three. I'm picturing you flipping 35 pancakes, while
balancing on one leg...

> Good for
> me.

Yes indeed, good for you!
Congratulations!

Deb L

messages.subject: Re: about writing, industry, my leg

Meghan

messages.subject: about writing, industry, my leg
messages.msgSnippet: I should probably go find the writing thread at www.unschooling.com and deposit this, but I m not feeling so industrious today.  Or maybe the industry is
messages.messageBody:
I should probably go find the writing thread at www.unschooling.com and
deposit this, but I'm not feeling so industrious today. Or maybe the
industry is turned elsewhere!!

I CAN GO UPSTAIRS!!

Yesterday I made pancakes for the six or seven teenaged boys who were here,
and today I have two loaves of bread rising on the stove. Woohoo!!

I still get tired if I walk too much or stay up too much, but a week and a
half after getting the leg brace, I can walk without crutches some. Good for
me.

I hope my family doesn't start expecting me to do everything I used to do
right away! <g>

Oh... the writing thing will be in another post then.

Sandra
